clauses-english.clause: Ta,
Seen,
Meem.

3254.verse-english: These are the verses of the clear Book.

clauses-english.clause: These are the verses of the clear Book.

3255.verse-arabic: نَتْلُو عَلَيْكَ مِن نَّبَإِ مُوسَىٰ وَفِرْعَوْنَ بِالْحَقِّ لِقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
3255.verse-english: We recite to you from the news of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for a people who believe.

clauses-arabic.clause: نَتْلُو عَلَيْكَ مِن نَّبَإِ مُوسَىٰ وَفِرْعَوْنَ بِالْحَقِّ لِقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ

clauses-english.clause: We recite to you from the news of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for a people who believe.

3256.verse-arabic: إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ عَلَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَجَعَلَ أَهْلَهَا شِيَعًا يَسْتَضْعِفُ طَائِفَةً مِّنْهُمْ يُذَبِّحُ أَبْنَاءَهُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيِي نِسَاءَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
3256.verse-english: Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions, oppressing a sector among them, slaughtering their [newborn] sons and keeping their females alive. Indeed, he was of the corrupters.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions,
oppressing a sector among them,
slaughtering their [newborn] sons and keeping their females alive.
Indeed,
he was of the corrupters.

3257.verse-arabic: وَنُرِيدُ أَن نَّمُنَّ عَلَى الَّذِينَ اسْتُضْعِفُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَنَجْعَلَهُمْ أَئِمَّةً وَنَجْعَلَهُمُ الْوَارِثِينَ
3257.verse-english: And We wanted to confer favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors

clauses-arabic.clause: وَنُرِيدُ أَن نَّمُنَّ عَلَى الَّذِينَ اسْتُضْعِفُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَنَجْعَلَهُمْ أَئِمَّةً وَنَجْعَلَهُمُ الْوَارِثِينَ

clauses-english.clause: And We wanted to confer favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors

3258.verse-arabic: وَنُمَكِّنَ لَهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَنُرِيَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَامَانَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا مِنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَحْذَرُونَ
3258.verse-english: And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Haman and their soldiers through them that which they had feared.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَنُمَكِّنَ لَهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَنُرِيَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَامَانَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا مِنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَحْذَرُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Haman and their soldiers through them that which they had feared.

3259.verse-arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَرْضِعِيهِ ۖ فَإِذَا خِفْتِ عَلَيْهِ فَأَلْقِيهِ فِي الْيَمِّ وَلَا تَخَافِي وَلَا تَحْزَنِي ۖ إِنَّا رَادُّوهُ إِلَيْكِ وَجَاعِلُوهُ مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
3259.verse-english: And We inspired to the mother of Moses, "Suckle him; but when you fear for him, cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, We will return him to you and will make him [one] of the messengers."

clauses-english.clause: And We inspired to the mother of Moses,
"Suckle him;
but when you fear for him,
cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve.
Indeed,
We will return him to you and will make him [one] of the messengers.

3260.verse-arabic: فَالْتَقَطَهُ آلُ فِرْعَوْنَ لِيَكُونَ لَهُمْ عَدُوًّا وَحَزَنًا ۗ إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَامَانَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا كَانُوا خَاطِئِينَ
3260.verse-english: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river] so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief. Indeed, Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were deliberate sinners.

clauses-english.clause: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river] so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief.
Indeed,
Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were deliberate sinners.

3261.verse-arabic: وَقَالَتِ امْرَأَتُ فِرْعَوْنَ قُرَّتُ عَيْنٍ لِّي وَلَكَ ۖ لَا تَقْتُلُوهُ عَسَىٰ أَن يَنفَعَنَا أَوْ نَتَّخِذَهُ وَلَدًا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
3261.verse-english: And the wife of Pharaoh said, "[He will be] a comfort of the eye for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he may benefit us, or we may adopt him as a son." And they perceived not.

clauses-english.clause: And the wife of Pharaoh said,
"[He will be] a comfort of the eye for me and for you.
Do not kill him;
perhaps he may benefit us,
or we may adopt him as a son.
" And they perceived not.

3262.verse-arabic: وَأَصْبَحَ فُؤَادُ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰ فَارِغًا ۖ إِن كَادَتْ لَتُبْدِي بِهِ لَوْلَا أَن رَّبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قَلْبِهَا لِتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
3262.verse-english: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else]. She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him had We not bound fast her heart that she would be of the believers.

clauses-english.clause: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else].
She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him had We not bound fast her heart that she would be of the believers.

3263.verse-arabic: وَقَالَتْ لِأُخْتِهِ قُصِّيهِ ۖ فَبَصُرَتْ بِهِ عَن جُنُبٍ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
3263.verse-english: And she said to his sister, "Follow him"; so she watched him from a distance while they perceived not.

clauses-english.clause: And she said to his sister,
"Follow him";
so she watched him from a distance while they perceived not.

3264.verse-arabic: ۞ وَحَرَّمْنَا عَلَيْهِ الْمَرَاضِعَ مِن قَبْلُ فَقَالَتْ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ أَهْلِ بَيْتٍ يَكْفُلُونَهُ لَكُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُ نَاصِحُونَ
3264.verse-english: And We had prevented from him [all] wet nurses before, so she said, "Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [for his upbringing] sincere?"

clauses-english.clause: And We had prevented from him [all] wet nurses before,
so she said,
"Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [for his upbringing] sincere?

3265.verse-arabic: فَرَدَدْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ أُمِّهِ كَيْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ وَلِتَعْلَمَ أَنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
3265.verse-english: So We restored him to his mother that she might be content and not grieve and that she would know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of the people do not know.

clauses-english.clause: So We restored him to his mother that she might be content and not grieve and that she would know that the promise of God is true.
But most of the people do not know.

3266.verse-arabic: وَلَمَّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ وَاسْتَوَىٰ آتَيْنَاهُ حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
3266.verse-english: And when he attained his full strength and was [mentally] mature, We bestowed upon him judgement and knowledge. And thus do We reward the doers of good.

clauses-english.clause: And when he attained his full strength and was [mentally] mature,
We bestowed upon him judgement and knowledge.
And thus do We reward the doers of good.

3267.verse-arabic: وَدَخَلَ الْمَدِينَةَ عَلَىٰ حِينِ غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ أَهْلِهَا فَوَجَدَ فِيهَا رَجُلَيْنِ يَقْتَتِلَانِ هَٰذَا مِن شِيعَتِهِ وَهَٰذَا مِنْ عَدُوِّهِ ۖ فَاسْتَغَاثَهُ الَّذِي مِن شِيعَتِهِ عَلَى الَّذِي مِنْ عَدُوِّهِ فَوَكَزَهُ مُوسَىٰ فَقَضَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ۖ قَالَ هَٰذَا مِنْ عَمَلِ الشَّيْطَانِ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَدُوٌّ مُّضِلٌّ مُّبِينٌ
3267.verse-english: And he entered the city at a time of inattention by its people and found therein two men fighting: one from his faction and one from among his enemy. And the one from his faction called for help to him against the one from his enemy, so Moses struck him and [unintentionally] killed him. [Moses] said, "This is from the work of Satan. Indeed, he is a manifest, misleading enemy."

clauses-english.clause: And he entered the city at a time of inattention by its people and found therein two men fighting:
one from his faction and one from among his enemy.
And the one from his faction called for help to him against the one from his enemy,
so Moses struck him and [unintentionally] killed him.
[Moses] said,
"This is from the work of Satan.
Indeed,
he is a manifest,
misleading enemy.

3268.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَغَفَرَ لَهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
3268.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me," and He forgave him. Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"My Lord,
indeed I have wronged myself,
so forgive me,
" and He forgave him.
Indeed,
He is the Forgiving,
the Merciful.

3269.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَا أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ فَلَنْ أَكُونَ ظَهِيرًا لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ
3269.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, for the favor You bestowed upon me, I will never be an assistant to the criminals."

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"My Lord,
for the favor You bestowed upon me,
I will never be an assistant to the criminals.

3270.verse-arabic: فَأَصْبَحَ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ خَائِفًا يَتَرَقَّبُ فَإِذَا الَّذِي اسْتَنصَرَهُ بِالْأَمْسِ يَسْتَصْرِخُهُ ۚ قَالَ لَهُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّكَ لَغَوِيٌّ مُّبِينٌ
3270.verse-english: And he became inside the city fearful and anticipating [exposure], when suddenly the one who sought his help the previous day cried out to him [once again]. Moses said to him, "Indeed, you are an evident, [persistent] deviator."

clauses-english.clause: And he became inside the city fearful and anticipating [exposure],
when suddenly the one who sought his help the previous day cried out to him [once again].
Moses said to him,
"Indeed,
you are an evident,
[persistent] deviator.

3271.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا أَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَبْطِشَ بِالَّذِي هُوَ عَدُوٌّ لَّهُمَا قَالَ يَا مُوسَىٰ أَتُرِيدُ أَن تَقْتُلَنِي كَمَا قَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا بِالْأَمْسِ ۖ إِن تُرِيدُ إِلَّا أَن تَكُونَ جَبَّارًا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا تُرِيدُ أَن تَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُصْلِحِينَ
3271.verse-english: And when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to both of them, he said, "O Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and do not want to be of the amenders."

clauses-english.clause: And when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to both of them,
he said,
"O Moses,
do you intend to kill me as you killed someone yesterday?
You only want to be a tyrant in the land and do not want to be of the amenders.

3272.verse-arabic: وَجَاءَ رَجُلٌ مِّنْ أَقْصَى الْمَدِينَةِ يَسْعَىٰ قَالَ يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّ الْمَلَأَ يَأْتَمِرُونَ بِكَ لِيَقْتُلُوكَ فَاخْرُجْ إِنِّي لَكَ مِنَ النَّاصِحِينَ
3272.verse-english: And a man came from the farthest end of the city, running. He said, "O Moses, indeed the eminent ones are conferring over you [intending] to kill you, so leave [the city]; indeed, I am to you of the sincere advisors."

clauses-english.clause: And a man came from the farthest end of the city,
running.
He said,
"O Moses,
indeed the eminent ones are conferring over you [intending] to kill you,
so leave [the city];
indeed,
I am to you of the sincere advisors.

3273.verse-arabic: فَخَرَجَ مِنْهَا خَائِفًا يَتَرَقَّبُ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ نَجِّنِي مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
3273.verse-english: So he left it, fearful and anticipating [apprehension]. He said, "My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people."

clauses-english.clause: So he left it,
fearful and anticipating [apprehension].
He said,
"My Lord,
save me from the wrongdoing people.

3274.verse-arabic: وَلَمَّا تَوَجَّهَ تِلْقَاءَ مَدْيَنَ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبِّي أَن يَهْدِيَنِي سَوَاءَ السَّبِيلِ
3274.verse-english: And when he directed himself toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the sound way."

clauses-english.clause: And when he directed himself toward Madyan,
he said,
"Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the sound way.

3275.verse-arabic: وَلَمَّا وَرَدَ مَاءَ مَدْيَنَ وَجَدَ عَلَيْهِ أُمَّةً مِّنَ النَّاسِ يَسْقُونَ وَوَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمُ امْرَأَتَيْنِ تَذُودَانِ ۖ قَالَ مَا خَطْبُكُمَا ۖ قَالَتَا لَا نَسْقِي حَتَّىٰ يُصْدِرَ الرِّعَاءُ ۖ وَأَبُونَا شَيْخٌ كَبِيرٌ
3275.verse-english: And when he came to the well of Madyan, he found there a crowd of people watering [their flocks], and he found aside from them two women driving back [their flocks]. He said, "What is your circumstance?" They said, "We do not water until the shepherds dispatch [their flocks]; and our father is an old man."

clauses-english.clause: And when he came to the well of Madyan,
he found there a crowd of people watering [their flocks],
and he found aside from them two women driving back [their flocks].
He said,
"What is your circumstance?
" They said,
"We do not water until the shepherds dispatch [their flocks];
and our father is an old man.

3276.verse-arabic: فَسَقَىٰ لَهُمَا ثُمَّ تَوَلَّىٰ إِلَى الظِّلِّ فَقَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي لِمَا أَنزَلْتَ إِلَيَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَقِيرٌ
3276.verse-english: So he watered [their flocks] for them; then he went back to the shade and said, "My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need."

clauses-english.clause: So he watered [their flocks] for them;
then he went back to the shade and said,
"My Lord,
indeed I am,
for whatever good You would send down to me,
in need.

3277.verse-arabic: فَجَاءَتْهُ إِحْدَاهُمَا تَمْشِي عَلَى اسْتِحْيَاءٍ قَالَتْ إِنَّ أَبِي يَدْعُوكَ لِيَجْزِيَكَ أَجْرَ مَا سَقَيْتَ لَنَا ۚ فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُ وَقَصَّ عَلَيْهِ الْقَصَصَ قَالَ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ نَجَوْتَ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
3277.verse-english: Then one of the two women came to him walking with shyness. She said, "Indeed, my father invites you that he may reward you for having watered for us." So when he came to him and related to him the story, he said, "Fear not. You have escaped from the wrongdoing people."

clauses-english.clause: Then one of the two women came to him walking with shyness.
She said,
"Indeed,
my father invites you that he may reward you for having watered for us.
" So when he came to him and related to him the story,
he said,
"Fear not.
You have escaped from the wrongdoing people.

3278.verse-arabic: قَالَتْ إِحْدَاهُمَا يَا أَبَتِ اسْتَأْجِرْهُ ۖ إِنَّ خَيْرَ مَنِ اسْتَأْجَرْتَ الْقَوِيُّ الْأَمِينُ
3278.verse-english: One of the women said, "O my father, hire him. Indeed, the best one you can hire is the strong and the trustworthy."

clauses-english.clause: One of the women said,
"O my father,
hire him.
Indeed,
the best one you can hire is the strong and the trustworthy.

3279.verse-arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُنكِحَكَ إِحْدَى ابْنَتَيَّ هَاتَيْنِ عَلَىٰ أَن تَأْجُرَنِي ثَمَانِيَ حِجَجٍ ۖ فَإِنْ أَتْمَمْتَ عَشْرًا فَمِنْ عِندِكَ ۖ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَشُقَّ عَلَيْكَ ۚ سَتَجِدُنِي إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
3279.verse-english: He said, "Indeed, I wish to wed you one of these, my two daughters, on [the condition] that you serve me for eight years; but if you complete ten, it will be [as a favor] from you. And I do not wish to put you in difficulty. You will find me, if Allah wills, from among the righteous."

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"Indeed,
I wish to wed you one of these,
my two daughters,
on [the condition] that you serve me for eight years;
but if you complete ten,
it will be [as a favor] from you.
And I do not wish to put you in difficulty.
You will find me,
if God wills,
from among the righteous.

3280.verse-arabic: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكَ ۖ أَيَّمَا الْأَجَلَيْنِ قَضَيْتُ فَلَا عُدْوَانَ عَلَيَّ ۖ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٌ
3280.verse-english: [Moses] said, "That is [established] between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I complete - there is no injustice to me, and Allah, over what we say, is Witness."

clauses-english.clause: [Moses] said,
"That is [established] between me and you.
Whichever of the two terms I complete -
there is no injustice to me,
and God,
over what we say,
is Witness.

3281.verse-arabic: ۞ فَلَمَّا قَضَىٰ مُوسَى الْأَجَلَ وَسَارَ بِأَهْلِهِ آنَسَ مِن جَانِبِ الطُّورِ نَارًا قَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ امْكُثُوا إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا لَّعَلِّي آتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ جَذْوَةٍ مِّنَ النَّارِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
3281.verse-english: And when Moses had completed the term and was traveling with his family, he perceived from the direction of the mount a fire. He said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire. Perhaps I will bring you from there [some] information or burning wood from the fire that you may warm yourselves."

clauses-english.clause: And when Moses had completed the term and was traveling with his family,
he perceived from the direction of the mount a fire.
He said to his family,
"Stay here;
indeed,
I have perceived a fire.
Perhaps I will bring you from there [some] information or burning wood from the fire that you may warm yourselves.

3282.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا أَتَاهَا نُودِيَ مِن شَاطِئِ الْوَادِ الْأَيْمَنِ فِي الْبُقْعَةِ الْمُبَارَكَةِ مِنَ الشَّجَرَةِ أَن يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنِّي أَنَا اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
3282.verse-english: But when he came to it, he was called from the right side of the valley in a blessed spot - from the tree, "O Moses, indeed I am Allah, Lord of the worlds."

clauses-english.clause: But when he came to it,
he was called from the right side of the valley in a blessed spot -
from the tree,
"O Moses,
indeed I am God,
Lord of the worlds.

3283.verse-arabic: وَأَنْ أَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَآهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَانٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَا مُوسَىٰ أَقْبِلْ وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ إِنَّكَ مِنَ الْآمِنِينَ
3283.verse-english: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it was a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], "O Moses, approach and fear not. Indeed, you are of the secure.

clauses-english.clause: And [he was told],
"Throw down your staff.
" But when he saw it writhing as if it was a snake,
he turned in flight and did not return.
[God said],
"O Moses,
approach and fear not.
Indeed,
you are of the secure.

3284.verse-arabic: اسْلُكْ يَدَكَ فِي جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ وَاضْمُمْ إِلَيْكَ جَنَاحَكَ مِنَ الرَّهْبِ ۖ فَذَانِكَ بُرْهَانَانِ مِن رَّبِّكَ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَئِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
3284.verse-english: Insert your hand into the opening of your garment; it will come out white, without disease. And draw in your arm close to you [as prevention] from fear, for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his establishment. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

clauses-english.clause: Insert your hand into the opening of your garment;
it will come out white,
without disease.
And draw in your arm close to you [as prevention] from fear,
for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his establishment.
Indeed,
they have been a people defiantly disobedient.

3285.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي قَتَلْتُ مِنْهُمْ نَفْسًا فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
3285.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, indeed, I killed from among them someone, and I fear they will kill me.

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"My Lord,
indeed,
I killed from among them someone,
and I fear they will kill me.

3286.verse-arabic: وَأَخِي هَارُونُ هُوَ أَفْصَحُ مِنِّي لِسَانًا فَأَرْسِلْهُ مَعِيَ رِدْءًا يُصَدِّقُنِي ۖ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
3286.verse-english: And my brother Aaron is more fluent than me in tongue, so send him with me as support, verifying me. Indeed, I fear that they will deny me."

clauses-english.clause: And my brother Aaron is more fluent than me in tongue,
so send him with me as support,
verifying me.
Indeed,
I fear that they will deny me.

3287.verse-arabic: قَالَ سَنَشُدُّ عَضُدَكَ بِأَخِيكَ وَنَجْعَلُ لَكُمَا سُلْطَانًا فَلَا يَصِلُونَ إِلَيْكُمَا ۚ بِآيَاتِنَا أَنتُمَا وَمَنِ اتَّبَعَكُمَا الْغَالِبُونَ
3287.verse-english: [Allah] said, "We will strengthen your arm through your brother and grant you both supremacy so they will not reach you. [It will be] through Our signs; you and those who follow you will be the predominant."

clauses-english.clause: [God] said,
"We will strengthen your arm through your brother and grant you both supremacy so they will not reach you.
[It will be] through Our signs;
you and those who follow you will be the predominant.

3288.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُم مُّوسَىٰ بِآيَاتِنَا بَيِّنَاتٍ قَالُوا مَا هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّفْتَرًى وَمَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي آبَائِنَا الْأَوَّلِينَ
3288.verse-english: But when Moses came to them with Our signs as clear evidences, they said, "This is not except invented magic, and we have not heard of this [religion] among our forefathers."

clauses-english.clause: But when Moses came to them with Our signs as clear evidences,
they said,
"This is not except invented magic,
and we have not heard of this [religion] among our forefathers.

3289.verse-arabic: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ رَبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِمَن جَاءَ بِالْهُدَىٰ مِنْ عِندِهِ وَمَن تَكُونُ لَهُ عَاقِبَةُ الدَّارِ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الظَّالِمُونَ
3289.verse-english: And Moses said, "My Lord is more knowing [than we or you] of who has come with guidance from Him and to whom will be succession in the home. Indeed, wrongdoers do not succeed."

clauses-english.clause: And Moses said,
"My Lord is more knowing [than we or you] of who has come with guidance from Him and to whom will be succession in the home.
Indeed,
wrongdoers do not succeed.

3290.verse-arabic: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ مَا عَلِمْتُ لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرِي فَأَوْقِدْ لِي يَا هَامَانُ عَلَى الطِّينِ فَاجْعَل لِّي صَرْحًا لَّعَلِّي أَطَّلِعُ إِلَىٰ إِلَٰهِ مُوسَىٰ وَإِنِّي لَأَظُنُّهُ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
3290.verse-english: And Pharaoh said, "O eminent ones, I have not known you to have a god other than me. Then ignite for me, O Haman, [a fire] upon the clay and make for me a tower that I may look at the God of Moses. And indeed, I do think he is among the liars."

clauses-english.clause: And Pharaoh said,
"O eminent ones,
I have not known you to have a god other than me.
Then ignite for me,
O Haman,
[a fire] upon the clay and make for me a tower that I may look at the God of Moses.
And indeed,
I do think he is among the liars.

3291.verse-arabic: وَاسْتَكْبَرَ هُوَ وَجُنُودُهُ فِي الْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ الْحَقِّ وَظَنُّوا أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا يُرْجَعُونَ
3291.verse-english: And he was arrogant, he and his soldiers, in the land, without right, and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.

clauses-english.clause: And he was arrogant,
he and his soldiers,
in the land,
without right,
and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.

3292.verse-arabic: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ ۖ فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الظَّالِمِينَ
3292.verse-english: So We took him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea. So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.

clauses-english.clause: So We took him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea.
So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.

3293.verse-arabic: وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ أَئِمَّةً يَدْعُونَ إِلَى النَّارِ ۖ وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ لَا يُنصَرُونَ
3293.verse-english: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.

clauses-english.clause: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire,
and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.

3294.verse-arabic: وَأَتْبَعْنَاهُمْ فِي هَٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا لَعْنَةً ۖ وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ هُم مِّنَ الْمَقْبُوحِينَ
3294.verse-english: And We caused to overtake them in this world a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be of the despised.

clauses-english.clause: And We caused to overtake them in this world a curse,
and on the Day of Resurrection they will be of the despised.

3295.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ مِن بَعْدِ مَا أَهْلَكْنَا الْقُرُونَ الْأُولَىٰ بَصَائِرَ لِلنَّاسِ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
3295.verse-english: And We gave Moses the Scripture, after We had destroyed the former generations, as enlightenment for the people and guidance and mercy that they might be reminded.

clauses-english.clause: And We gave Moses the Scripture,
after We had destroyed the former generations,
as enlightenment for the people and guidance and mercy that they might be reminded.

3296.verse-arabic: وَمَا كُنتَ بِجَانِبِ الْغَرْبِيِّ إِذْ قَضَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَى الْأَمْرَ وَمَا كُنتَ مِنَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
3296.verse-english: And you, [O Muhammad], were not on the western side [of the mount] when We revealed to Moses the command, and you were not among the witnesses [to that].

clauses-english.clause: And you,
[O Muhammad],
were not on the western side [of the mount] when We revealed to Moses the command,
and you were not among the witnesses [to that].

3297.verse-arabic: وَلَٰكِنَّا أَنشَأْنَا قُرُونًا فَتَطَاوَلَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْعُمُرُ ۚ وَمَا كُنتَ ثَاوِيًا فِي أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ تَتْلُو عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِنَا وَلَٰكِنَّا كُنَّا مُرْسِلِينَ
3297.verse-english: But We produced [many] generations [after Moses], and prolonged was their duration. And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan, reciting to them Our verses, but We were senders [of this message].

clauses-english.clause: But We produced [many] generations [after Moses],
and prolonged was their duration.
And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan,
reciting to them Our verses,
but We were senders [of this message].

3298.verse-arabic: وَمَا كُنتَ بِجَانِبِ الطُّورِ إِذْ نَادَيْنَا وَلَٰكِن رَّحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ لِتُنذِرَ قَوْمًا مَّا أَتَاهُم مِّن نَّذِيرٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
3298.verse-english: And you were not at the side of the mount when We called [Moses] but [were sent] as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you that they might be reminded.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمَا كُنتَ بِجَانِبِ الطُّورِ إِذْ نَادَيْنَا وَلَٰكِن رَّحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ لِتُنذِرَ قَوْمًا مَّا أَتَاهُم مِّن نَّذِيرٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And you were not at the side of the mount when We called [Moses] but [were sent] as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you that they might be reminded.

3299.verse-arabic: وَلَوْلَا أَن تُصِيبَهُم مُّصِيبَةٌ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُوا رَبَّنَا لَوْلَا أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًا فَنَتَّبِعَ آيَاتِكَ وَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
3299.verse-english: And if not that a disaster should strike them for what their hands put forth [of sins] and they would say, "Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"...

clauses-english.clause: And if not that a disaster should strike them for what their hands put forth [of sins] and they would say,
"Our Lord,
why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?

3300.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُمُ الْحَقُّ مِنْ عِندِنَا قَالُوا لَوْلَا أُوتِيَ مِثْلَ مَا أُوتِيَ مُوسَىٰ ۚ أَوَلَمْ يَكْفُرُوا بِمَا أُوتِيَ مُوسَىٰ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ قَالُوا سِحْرَانِ تَظَاهَرَا وَقَالُوا إِنَّا بِكُلٍّ كَافِرُونَ
3300.verse-english: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Why was he not given like that which was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before? They said, "[They are but] two works of magic supporting each other, and indeed we are, in both, disbelievers."

clauses-english.clause: But when the truth came to them from Us,
they said,
"Why was he not given like that which was given to Moses?
" Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before?
They said,
"[They are but] two works of magic supporting each other,
and indeed we are,
in both,
disbelievers.

3301.verse-arabic: قُلْ فَأْتُوا بِكِتَابٍ مِّنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ هُوَ أَهْدَىٰ مِنْهُمَا أَتَّبِعْهُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
3301.verse-english: Say, "Then bring a scripture from Allah which is more guiding than either of them that I may follow it, if you should be truthful."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"Then bring a scripture from God which is more guiding than either of them that I may follow it,
if you should be truthful.

3302.verse-arabic: فَإِن لَّمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا لَكَ فَاعْلَمْ أَنَّمَا يَتَّبِعُونَ أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَمَنْ أَضَلُّ مِمَّنِ اتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ بِغَيْرِ هُدًى مِّنَ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
3302.verse-english: But if they do not respond to you - then know that they only follow their [own] desires. And who is more astray than one who follows his desire without guidance from Allah? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

clauses-english.clause: But if they do not respond to you -
then know that they only follow their [own] desires.
And who is more astray than one who follows his desire without guidance from God?
Indeed,
God does not guide the wrongdoing people.

3303.verse-arabic: ۞ وَلَقَدْ وَصَّلْنَا لَهُمُ الْقَوْلَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
3303.verse-english: And We have [repeatedly] conveyed to them the Qur'an that they might be reminded.

clauses-arabic.clause: ۞ وَلَقَدْ وَصَّلْنَا لَهُمُ الْقَوْلَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And We have [repeatedly] conveyed to them the Qur'an that they might be reminded.

3304.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ مِن قَبْلِهِ هُم بِهِ يُؤْمِنُونَ
3304.verse-english: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it - they are believers in it.

clauses-english.clause: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it -
they are believers in it.

3305.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِهِ إِنَّهُ الْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلِهِ مُسْلِمِينَ
3305.verse-english: And when it is recited to them, they say, "We have believed in it; indeed, it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed we were, [even] before it, Muslims [submitting to Allah]."

clauses-english.clause: And when it is recited to them,
they say,
"We have believed in it;
indeed,
it is the truth from our Lord.
Indeed we were,
[even] before it,
Muslims [submitting to God].

3306.verse-arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ يُؤْتَوْنَ أَجْرَهُم مَّرَّتَيْنِ بِمَا صَبَرُوا وَيَدْرَءُونَ بِالْحَسَنَةِ السَّيِّئَةَ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَاهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
3306.verse-english: Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and [because] they avert evil through good, and from what We have provided them they spend.

clauses-english.clause: Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and [because] they avert evil through good,
and from what We have provided them they spend.

3307.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا سَمِعُوا اللَّغْوَ أَعْرَضُوا عَنْهُ وَقَالُوا لَنَا أَعْمَالُنَا وَلَكُمْ أَعْمَالُكُمْ سَلَامٌ عَلَيْكُمْ لَا نَبْتَغِي الْجَاهِلِينَ
3307.verse-english: And when they hear ill speech, they turn away from it and say, "For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. Peace will be upon you; we seek not the ignorant."

clauses-english.clause: And when they hear ill speech,
they turn away from it and say,
"For us are our deeds,
and for you are your deeds.
Peace will be upon you;
we seek not the ignorant.

3308.verse-arabic: إِنَّكَ لَا تَهْدِي مَنْ أَحْبَبْتَ وَلَٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يَهْدِي مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ
3308.verse-english: Indeed, [O Muhammad], you do not guide whom you like, but Allah guides whom He wills. And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
[O Muhammad],
you do not guide whom you like,
but God guides whom He wills.
And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

3309.verse-arabic: وَقَالُوا إِن نَّتَّبِعِ الْهُدَىٰ مَعَكَ نُتَخَطَّفْ مِنْ أَرْضِنَا ۚ أَوَلَمْ نُمَكِّن لَّهُمْ حَرَمًا آمِنًا يُجْبَىٰ إِلَيْهِ ثَمَرَاتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ رِّزْقًا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
3309.verse-english: And they say, "If we were to follow the guidance with you, we would be swept from our land." Have we not established for them a safe sanctuary to which are brought the fruits of all things as provision from Us? But most of them do not know.

clauses-english.clause: And they say,
"If we were to follow the guidance with you,
we would be swept from our land.
" Have we not established for them a safe sanctuary to which are brought the fruits of all things as provision from Us?
But most of them do not know.

3310.verse-arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ بَطِرَتْ مَعِيشَتَهَا ۖ فَتِلْكَ مَسَاكِنُهُمْ لَمْ تُسْكَن مِّن بَعْدِهِمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا ۖ وَكُنَّا نَحْنُ الْوَارِثِينَ
3310.verse-english: And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its [way of] living, and those are their dwellings which have not been inhabited after them except briefly. And it is We who were the inheritors.

clauses-english.clause: And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its [way of] living,
and those are their dwellings which have not been inhabited after them except briefly.
And it is We who were the inheritors.

3311.verse-arabic: وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ مُهْلِكَ الْقُرَىٰ حَتَّىٰ يَبْعَثَ فِي أُمِّهَا رَسُولًا يَتْلُو عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِنَا ۚ وَمَا كُنَّا مُهْلِكِي الْقُرَىٰ إِلَّا وَأَهْلُهَا ظَالِمُونَ
3311.verse-english: And never would your Lord have destroyed the cities until He had sent to their mother a messenger reciting to them Our verses. And We would not destroy the cities except while their people were wrongdoers.

clauses-english.clause: And never would your Lord have destroyed the cities until He had sent to their mother a messenger reciting to them Our verses.
And We would not destroy the cities except while their people were wrongdoers.

3312.verse-arabic: وَمَا أُوتِيتُم مِّن شَيْءٍ فَمَتَاعُ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَزِينَتُهَا ۚ وَمَا عِندَ اللَّهِ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
3312.verse-english: And whatever thing you [people] have been given - it is [only for] the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment. And what is with Allah is better and more lasting; so will you not use reason?

clauses-english.clause: And whatever thing you [people] have been given -
it is [only for] the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment.
And what is with God is better and more lasting;
so will you not use reason?

3313.verse-arabic: أَفَمَن وَعَدْنَاهُ وَعْدًا حَسَنًا فَهُوَ لَاقِيهِ كَمَن مَّتَّعْنَاهُ مَتَاعَ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ثُمَّ هُوَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ مِنَ الْمُحْضَرِينَ
3313.verse-english: Then is he whom We have promised a good promise which he will obtain like he for whom We provided enjoyment of worldly life [but] then he is, on the Day of Resurrection, among those presented [for punishment in Hell]?

clauses-english.clause: Then is he whom We have promised a good promise which he will obtain like he for whom We provided enjoyment of worldly life [but] then he is,
on the Day of Resurrection,
among those presented [for punishment in Hell]?

3314.verse-arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَائِيَ الَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تَزْعُمُونَ
3314.verse-english: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My 'partners' which you used to claim?"

clauses-english.clause: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say,
"Where are My 'partners' which you used to claim?

3315.verse-arabic: قَالَ الَّذِينَ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِمُ الْقَوْلُ رَبَّنَا هَٰؤُلَاءِ الَّذِينَ أَغْوَيْنَا أَغْوَيْنَاهُمْ كَمَا غَوَيْنَا ۖ تَبَرَّأْنَا إِلَيْكَ ۖ مَا كَانُوا إِيَّانَا يَعْبُدُونَ
3315.verse-english: Those upon whom the word will have come into effect will say, "Our Lord, these are the ones we led to error. We led them to error just as we were in error. We declare our disassociation [from them] to You. They did not used to worship us."

clauses-english.clause: Those upon whom the word will have come into effect will say,
"Our Lord,
these are the ones we led to error.
We led them to error just as we were in error.
We declare our disassociation [from them] to You.
They did not used to worship us.

3316.verse-arabic: وَقِيلَ ادْعُوا شُرَكَاءَكُمْ فَدَعَوْهُمْ فَلَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا لَهُمْ وَرَأَوُا الْعَذَابَ ۚ لَوْ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يَهْتَدُونَ
3316.verse-english: And it will be said, "Invoke your 'partners' " and they will invoke them; but they will not respond to them, and they will see the punishment. If only they had followed guidance!

clauses-english.clause: And it will be said,
"Invoke your 'partners' " and they will invoke them;
but they will not respond to them,
and they will see the punishment.
If only they had followed guidance!

3317.verse-arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ مَاذَا أَجَبْتُمُ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
3317.verse-english: And [mention] the Day He will call them and say, "What did you answer the messengers?"

clauses-english.clause: And [mention] the Day He will call them and say,
"What did you answer the messengers?

3318.verse-arabic: فَعَمِيَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ الْأَنبَاءُ يَوْمَئِذٍ فَهُمْ لَا يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
3318.verse-english: But the information will be unapparent to them that Day, so they will not [be able to] ask one another.

clauses-english.clause: But the information will be unapparent to them that Day,
so they will not [be able to] ask one another.

3319.verse-arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَعَسَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُفْلِحِينَ
3319.verse-english: But as for one who had repented, believed, and done righteousness, it is promised by Allah that he will be among the successful.

clauses-english.clause: But as for one who had repented,
believed,
and done righteousness,
it is promised by God that he will be among the successful.

3320.verse-arabic: وَرَبُّكَ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَاءُ وَيَخْتَارُ ۗ مَا كَانَ لَهُمُ الْخِيَرَةُ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَتَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
3320.verse-english: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; not for them was the choice. Exalted is Allah and high above what they associate with Him.

clauses-english.clause: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses;
not for them was the choice.
Exalted is God and high above what they associate with Him.

3321.verse-arabic: وَرَبُّكَ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
3321.verse-english: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَرَبُّكَ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

3322.verse-arabic: وَهُوَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ فِي الْأُولَىٰ وَالْآخِرَةِ ۖ وَلَهُ الْحُكْمُ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
3322.verse-english: And He is Allah; there is no deity except Him. To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter. And His is the [final] decision, and to Him you will be returned.

clauses-english.clause: And He is God;
there is no deity except Him.
To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter.
And His is the [final] decision,
and to Him you will be returned.

3323.verse-arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِن جَعَلَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمُ اللَّيْلَ سَرْمَدًا إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ مَنْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ يَأْتِيكُم بِضِيَاءٍ ۖ أَفَلَا تَسْمَعُونَ
3323.verse-english: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you light? Then will you not hear?"

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"Have you considered:
if God should make for you the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection,
what deity other than God could bring you light?
Then will you not hear?

3324.verse-arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِن جَعَلَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْكُمُ النَّهَارَ سَرْمَدًا إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ مَنْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ يَأْتِيكُم بِلَيْلٍ تَسْكُنُونَ فِيهِ ۖ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
3324.verse-english: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the day continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you a night in which you may rest? Then will you not see?"

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"Have you considered:
if God should make for you the day continuous until the Day of Resurrection,
what deity other than God could bring you a night in which you may rest?
Then will you not see?

3325.verse-arabic: وَمِن رَّحْمَتِهِ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ لِتَسْكُنُوا فِيهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا مِن فَضْلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
3325.verse-english: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day that you may rest therein and [by day] seek from His bounty and [that] perhaps you will be grateful.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمِن رَّحْمَتِهِ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ لِتَسْكُنُوا فِيهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا مِن فَضْلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day that you may rest therein and [by day] seek from His bounty and [that] perhaps you will be grateful.

3326.verse-arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَائِيَ الَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تَزْعُمُونَ
3326.verse-english: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are my 'partners' which you used to claim?"

clauses-english.clause: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say,
"Where are my 'partners' which you used to claim?

3327.verse-arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ شَهِيدًا فَقُلْنَا هَاتُوا بُرْهَانَكُمْ فَعَلِمُوا أَنَّ الْحَقَّ لِلَّهِ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَفْتَرُونَ
3327.verse-english: And We will extract from every nation a witness and say, "Produce your proof," and they will know that the truth belongs to Allah, and lost from them is that which they used to invent.

clauses-english.clause: And We will extract from every nation a witness and say,
"Produce your proof,
" and they will know that the truth belongs to God,
and lost from them is that which they used to invent.

3328.verse-arabic: ۞ إِنَّ قَارُونَ كَانَ مِن قَوْمِ مُوسَىٰ فَبَغَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ وَآتَيْنَاهُ مِنَ الْكُنُوزِ مَا إِنَّ مَفَاتِحَهُ لَتَنُوءُ بِالْعُصْبَةِ أُولِي الْقُوَّةِ إِذْ قَالَ لَهُ قَوْمُهُ لَا تَفْرَحْ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ الْفَرِحِينَ
3328.verse-english: Indeed, Qarun was from the people of Moses, but he tyrannized them. And We gave him of treasures whose keys would burden a band of strong men; thereupon his people said to him, "Do not exult. Indeed, Allah does not like the exultant.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
Qarun was from the people of Moses,
but he tyrannized them.
And We gave him of treasures whose keys would burden a band of strong men;
thereupon his people said to him,
"Do not exult.
Indeed,
God does not like the exultant.

3329.verse-arabic: وَابْتَغِ فِيمَا آتَاكَ اللَّهُ الدَّارَ الْآخِرَةَ ۖ وَلَا تَنسَ نَصِيبَكَ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا ۖ وَأَحْسِن كَمَا أَحْسَنَ اللَّهُ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَلَا تَبْغِ الْفَسَادَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
3329.verse-english: But seek, through that which Allah has given you, the home of the Hereafter; and [yet], do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allah has done good to you. And desire not corruption in the land. Indeed, Allah does not like corrupters."

clauses-english.clause: But seek,
through that which God has given you,
the home of the Hereafter;
and [yet],
do not forget your share of the world.
And do good as God has done good to you.
And desire not corruption in the land.
Indeed,
God does not like corrupters.

3330.verse-arabic: قَالَ إِنَّمَا أُوتِيتُهُ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ عِندِي ۚ أَوَلَمْ يَعْلَمْ أَنَّ اللَّهَ قَدْ أَهْلَكَ مِن قَبْلِهِ مِنَ الْقُرُونِ مَنْ هُوَ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُ قُوَّةً وَأَكْثَرُ جَمْعًا ۚ وَلَا يُسْأَلُ عَن ذُنُوبِهِمُ الْمُجْرِمُونَ
3330.verse-english: He said, "I was only given it because of knowledge I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him of generations those who were greater than him in power and greater in accumulation [of wealth]? But the criminals, about their sins, will not be asked.

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"I was only given it because of knowledge I have.
" Did he not know that God had destroyed before him of generations those who were greater than him in power and greater in accumulation [of wealth]?
But the criminals,
about their sins,
will not be asked.

3331.verse-arabic: فَخَرَجَ عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ فِي زِينَتِهِ ۖ قَالَ الَّذِينَ يُرِيدُونَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا يَا لَيْتَ لَنَا مِثْلَ مَا أُوتِيَ قَارُونُ إِنَّهُ لَذُو حَظٍّ عَظِيمٍ
3331.verse-english: So he came out before his people in his adornment. Those who desired the worldly life said, "Oh, would that we had like what was given to Qarun. Indeed, he is one of great fortune."

clauses-english.clause: So he came out before his people in his adornment.
Those who desired the worldly life said,
"Oh,
would that we had like what was given to Qarun.
Indeed,
he is one of great fortune.

3332.verse-arabic: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْعِلْمَ وَيْلَكُمْ ثَوَابُ اللَّهِ خَيْرٌ لِّمَنْ آمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا وَلَا يُلَقَّاهَا إِلَّا الصَّابِرُونَ
3332.verse-english: But those who had been given knowledge said, "Woe to you! The reward of Allah is better for he who believes and does righteousness. And none are granted it except the patient."

clauses-english.clause: But those who had been given knowledge said,
"Woe to you!
The reward of God is better for he who believes and does righteousness.
And none are granted it except the patient.

3333.verse-arabic: فَخَسَفْنَا بِهِ وَبِدَارِهِ الْأَرْضَ فَمَا كَانَ لَهُ مِن فِئَةٍ يَنصُرُونَهُ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُنتَصِرِينَ
3333.verse-english: And We caused the earth to swallow him and his home. And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor was he of those who [could] defend themselves.

clauses-english.clause: And We caused the earth to swallow him and his home.
And there was for him no company to aid him other than God,
nor was he of those who [could] defend themselves.

3334.verse-arabic: وَأَصْبَحَ الَّذِينَ تَمَنَّوْا مَكَانَهُ بِالْأَمْسِ يَقُولُونَ وَيْكَأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَبْسُطُ الرِّزْقَ لِمَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ وَيَقْدِرُ ۖ لَوْلَا أَن مَّنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا لَخَسَفَ بِنَا ۖ وَيْكَأَنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الْكَافِرُونَ
3334.verse-english: And those who had wished for his position the previous day began to say, "Oh, how Allah extends provision to whom He wills of His servants and restricts it! If not that Allah had conferred favor on us, He would have caused it to swallow us. Oh, how the disbelievers do not succeed!"

clauses-english.clause: And those who had wished for his position the previous day began to say,
"Oh,
how God extends provision to whom He wills of His servants and restricts it!
If not that God had conferred favor on us,
He would have caused it to swallow us.
Oh,
how the disbelievers do not succeed!

3335.verse-arabic: تِلْكَ الدَّارُ الْآخِرَةُ نَجْعَلُهَا لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُرِيدُونَ عُلُوًّا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فَسَادًا ۚ وَالْعَاقِبَةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
3335.verse-english: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

clauses-english.clause: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption.
And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

3336.verse-arabic: مَن جَاءَ بِالْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُ خَيْرٌ مِّنْهَا ۖ وَمَن جَاءَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ فَلَا يُجْزَى الَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا السَّيِّئَاتِ إِلَّا مَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
3336.verse-english: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it; and whoever comes with an evil deed - then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed except [as much as] what they used to do.

clauses-english.clause: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it;
and whoever comes with an evil deed -
then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed except [as much as] what they used to do.

3337.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِي فَرَضَ عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ لَرَادُّكَ إِلَىٰ مَعَادٍ ۚ قُل رَّبِّي أَعْلَمُ مَن جَاءَ بِالْهُدَىٰ وَمَنْ هُوَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
3337.verse-english: Indeed, [O Muhammad], He who imposed upon you the Qur'an will take you back to a place of return. Say, "My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance and who is in clear error."

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
[O Muhammad],
He who imposed upon you the Qur'an will take you back to a place of return.
Say,
"My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance and who is in clear error.

3338.verse-arabic: وَمَا كُنتَ تَرْجُو أَن يُلْقَىٰ إِلَيْكَ الْكِتَابُ إِلَّا رَحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۖ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ ظَهِيرًا لِّلْكَافِرِينَ
3338.verse-english: And you were not expecting that the Book would be conveyed to you, but [it is] a mercy from your Lord. So do not be an assistant to the disbelievers.

clauses-english.clause: And you were not expecting that the Book would be conveyed to you,
but [it is] a mercy from your Lord.
So do not be an assistant to the disbelievers.

3339.verse-arabic: وَلَا يَصُدُّنَّكَ عَنْ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ بَعْدَ إِذْ أُنزِلَتْ إِلَيْكَ ۖ وَادْعُ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
3339.verse-english: And never let them avert you from the verses of Allah after they have been revealed to you. And invite [people] to your Lord. And never be of those who associate others with Allah.

clauses-english.clause: And never let them avert you from the verses of God after they have been revealed to you.
And invite [people] to your Lord.
And never be of those who associate others with God.

3340.verse-arabic: وَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۘ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ كُلُّ شَيْءٍ هَالِكٌ إِلَّا وَجْهَهُ ۚ لَهُ الْحُكْمُ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
3340.verse-english: And do not invoke with Allah another deity. There is no deity except Him. Everything will be destroyed except His Face. His is the judgement, and to Him you will be returned.

clauses-english.clause: And do not invoke with God another deity.
There is no deity except Him.
Everything will be destroyed except His Face.
His is the judgement,
and to Him you will be returned.
